data.title: Hangover Cure
data.text: We were in the area for a 3 day concert in Chicago.  We would stop by here every morning before heading out to the festival.  Best Ihop I've ever ate at.

data.title: Gone downhill :(
data.text: I LOVE breakfast food. who doesnt?! it's comfort food @ it's best. we've eaten at the IHOP near walmart and now they've opened this one by I-355. from what i see, history is repeating itself. when they first opened, the place was ah-mazing - my soul and my family were fed and satisfied. the last 2 times we've gone back, tho, things were different...my son's chicken tenders were overcooked crispy. they discontinued chicken parmesan. it was the one thing my daughter (and I) can eat everyday. my husband's fish tilapia lacked gravy and they ended up giving us a free meal. heck they even forgot to put the dressing on my salad! COME ON, GUYS! let me just add, i haven't walked out of a restaurant still feeling HUNGRY. i think even our server was embarrassed. having said all of that...i miss breakfast.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Bad bad experience!! To long to be seated,two people one setting placed one cup,food not up to par the waitress I adore was on vacation if you go there ask for Molly if you want good service. Not ever going back

data.title: Stick to What You Know
data.text: They are no longer at this location by Walmart. They are off I-355 Tollway, at the Boughton Rd, exit W. in Meijer's parking lot on Janes Ave. Since they relocated, the management, service, and food are so much better. Lots of breakfast items to choose from, and some basic lunch items too. Clean and comfortable.  Some of the monthly special items are hokey, like double dipped French toast. Who needs it rolled in cornflakes, and re-dipped in eggs? Nasty. Stick to the basics, and you can't go wrong. Excellent eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns, waffles, and of course pancakes.

data.title: Disappointment
data.text: Our server was great!!  No complaints with him at all.  We were seated first in an area with no other diners, after we were seated others were seated.  They got there food before us and left before us.  When we got our food, my husbands was cold and we had to send it back to be reheated.

data.title: IHOP Restaurant in Bolingbrook is at 730 N. Janes Ave. - Tasty Breakfast!!
data.text: I'm correcting the address of this IHOP restaurant since the 730 N. Janes Ave. address in Bolingbrook, IL is the one listed on IHOP's website. This was my first visit at the Bolingbrook IHOP. I was using my "free anniversary IHOP Club" breakfast coupon. I was extremely pleased with my meal. I had the 3-egg, 3 pancake, sausage/bacon & hash brown combo and a pot of freshly-brewed coffee. The service was also excellent. The waitress, Jatziri, made sure that I enjoyed my meal & came around my table several times to see if I needed anything else, quickly bringing ice-cold water upon my request. Make sure to ask for her. She's the best!

data.title: Wait till the novelty wears off
data.text: We used to have an IHOP in our town and it closed, despite its fairly good location. Now we have a new one -- just off the highway -- which is good since it is open 24 hours and probably gets more highway traffic.  I went with a group of friends for lunch and we had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated.  It was a school holiday and there were lots of families and kids there. It would be a good place to take kids since there are a lot of kid-friendly items, but we found the service less than stellar.  There was even a line waiting to pay at the cashier's table. I think the cashier was a bit new on the job.  I might return, but not on a weekend or holiday.

data.title: Sunday Breakfast
data.text:
Worst service possible, super busy but the staff should expect that on Sundays. 

Well ordered an omelet with no onions, what did I receive? Hmm an omelet with onions, the server never once returned it after I let her know about it, didn't even acknowledge to be apologetic at all, just listened and walked off. Management is very poor and everyone is running around without a clue of what they are doing. It to nearly 45 min to receive our food. I mean come on this is Ihop not some 4 star restaurant. 

The service in the original building near Walmart was much much more organized and had a friendlier staff.

data.title: SLOW and expen$ive pancake$
data.text: Really iHop? I thought I would grab a quick breakfast with my daughter and ended up spending over an hour and $33 for the 2 of us for BREAKFAST. Her meal - a cup of soup and a combo meal of egg, bacon, 2 pancakes, OJ and coffee. My meal - 3 pancakes and water. Add the poor service (super slow wait staff), no cutlery, no offer for additional pancakes and bill that needed to be adjusted because I was being charged $7.99 for my three (yes 3) pancakes even though they are advertising all-you-can-eat pancakes for $5.99. I left feeling ripped off. I was excited this restaurant was opening in our neighborhood but there is better value in some of the local diners or drive past the iHop and shop at the Meijer's in the same location, go home and make a week's worth of breakfasts for the same price.

data.title: Still working out the kinks
data.text: They've been open for about 3 weeks now and are still getting the feel of their new digs, new servers, and new management. We went there in the afternoon on the Monday following X-Mas, and the waiting area was packed with folks in line to be seated. Many of the tables and booths in the restaurant were available, so it must have been a staffing issue, either not enough servers or not enough cooks to meet demand. From a customer standpoint, (with "stand" being the operative word) I'd rather be seated comfortably at an empty table and be able to view the menu, chat with my companions, and have a glass of water or quick cup of coffee while I wait for a server, than to have to stand around at the front of the restaurant with a crowd of people all also waiting to be seated, jockeying for position, having to get out of the way for others to pass. (Presuming the host/hostess notifies us that it could take a while to place our orders or get our food.) It took about 10-15 minutes for the two of us to be seated, again, with about half of the tables empty, so they must not have expected the crowd on a Monday afternoon, long after breakfast/lunchtime. Our server was very friendly and talkative, if a bit ditsy. Definitely gets points for sweetness. (A quick note----We've had her on a previous visit, at which time she'd brought our beverages and taken our order, then forgotten about us until our meal was over. Another employee brought out our food, but we were missing some items, and couldn't catch anyone's attention to tell them. We ran out of a half-full carafe of coffee after less than 3 cups, needed more Equal, napkins, and no one ever stopped by to see how our meal was or if we needed drink refills. There were at least 2 management-types and 2 hostesses walking around, but we couldn't catch their attention, either. The busiest-looking, most attentive employee to walk past our table was the busboy, who didn't speak English. Our server came by after about 30 mins. and said, "I noticed it looked like you didn't get your bacon or gravy, I'll have my mgr. take it off the bill." Well, if you'd noticed that, why didn't you stop and ASK us while we were still eating?! I'd rather have had all my food items to improve the meal than the cost credit on an incomplete plate. It bears mention that this friendly, talkative server had 2 new arrivals seated into the booth right behind us, and she must have known them, as she proceeded to get into a lengthy conversation with them about college or some such, after taking their order. When she was done chatting, she turned and walked away so weren't able to catch her eye then, either. We chalked up that visit to inexperience. Now, back to our return visit.) She was polite as before, got our drinks right away, and took our order. She actually came back a few minutes later to check on us. (Our drinks) After about 10-15 more minutes, the food hadn't yet arrived, but we'd kind of expected that. My husband was just messing with his phone, and I was digging around in my purse, taking my wallet out to look for something, and the server came over and asked us if everything had been fine today. I said, "How do you mean?" and she replied, "With your food, how was your meal?" We explained that we were still waiting for our food. She seemed surprised, and said we looked like we were preparing to leave. We repeated that we hadn't yet eaten. She seemed confused, and we asked her to check on our food. She came out 2 mins. later with our food, which made us tend to think it had been sitting back there prepared and just waiting for someone to bring it to us before it got cold. At least, this time everything was there. The remainder of the meal was uneventful. Food was good, service Ehhhhhh. Interestingly, this time a management-type stopped by the table to ask how things were, but began to walk away before we even finished answering, as if she wasn't really interested in the response, she was just fulfilling a requirement. And no smile from her. Wild!! We'll keep going back because it's convenient, and hope that they get better at everything, but we noticed Sophie's in the old IHOP building so we'll be giving her a try. If we're lucky, we hope it's Mr. Waffles again, under a new name!!

data.title: Brand new- good foot
data.text:
We stopped here during the holiday season when the nearby restaurants across the street were absolutely packed with people. I think this IHOP is new enough that not enough people even know it's there, so we got right in and the restaurant barely had anyone in it.

It looks new and is clean. The service was definitely on the slow side, but the food was good.

data.title: New IHOP is open at Janes Ave. Meijer
data.text: The place wasn't busy yet, just "drop-ins" like us who have been watching to see when they were going to have their grand opening, which hasn't happened yet. Had the Chicken Fajita omelet which was huge and excellent, and the Caramel apple-topped Ham with Sweet potato fries & Broccoli, a side of Lingonberries (a Swedish condiment, like cranberry sauce) and a Potato soup. Very good! Our server was very attentive, but of course it wasn't yet busy. Their new location is very spacious and of course, new-looking, just not very decorative. We'll be back to try other dishes.

data.title: Ihope....
data.text: Stick with breakfast only.  We came here for dinner, and the food was terrible. Every entree looked and tasted like a frozen dinner that you buy at Jewel. I Hope you only order breakfast at IHop
